before_start:
{"blocks":[{"key":"6irs6","text":"Calibration and spiking standard solutions are prepared using certified sodium
monofluoroacetate standard materials, provided either neat or in solution.  Certified standard materials are available
from Cambridge Isotope Laboratories and other vendors.  Isotopically labeled sodium monofluoroacetate
(13C2, d2-sodium monofluoroacetate) is available as an internal standard (IS) from Cambridge Isotope Laboratories and other vendors.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":301,"length":2},{"style":"sub","offset":304,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":308,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8pkul","text":"

","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description:
{"blocks":[{"key":"4h9oc","text":"This diagnostic method provides for the identification and quantitative analysis of sodium monofluoroacetate (Compound 1080) from kidney tissue using LC-MS/MS","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cg31k","text":"
Sodium monofluoroacetate (Compound 1080) is an EPA Category I toxin.  In the US, its use is restricted to licensed applicators who may use it in bait collars to protect small ruminants.  Animal intoxication and death
are reported, giving a need for a rapid, sensitive diagnostic method for detection and quantitation of Compound 1080 in animal tissues, including kidney.  This SOP describes an LC-MS/MS method for the identification and quantitative analysis of Compound 1080 in kidney tissue at low ppb levels (e.g. ~5ppb).  The method is rapid, sensitive, and selective.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e9gfd","text":"
Validation data (in-house and by an independent laboratory via collaborative study such as Blinded Method Test) are available upon request. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
disclaimer: {"blocks":[{"key":"6gece","text":"Reference to any commercial materials, equipment, or process does not in any way constitute approval, endorsement, or recommendation by the Food and Drug Administration.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines:
{"blocks":[{"key":"7sdm3","text":"DEFINITIONS AND ACRONYMS ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":25}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fi9ah","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"902t","text":"Compound 1080 = Sodium monofluoroacetate","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4fre0","text":"ESI = Electrospray ionization","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4sl0m","text":"UHPLC = Ultra high performance liquid chromatograph","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"65ofe","text":"IS = Internal standard","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bbhgo","text":"LC-MS/MS = Liquid Chromatography/Mass Spectrometry/Mass
Spectrometry","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d6kr6","text":"MRM = Multiple reaction monitoring","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3h65f","text":"RL = Reporting limit","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"808q4","text":"SPE = Solid phase extraction","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1mgos","text":"
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6t62g","text":"SPECIMEN INFORMATION","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"78l7m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"30rtc","text":"5 g of kidney tissue (optimal).  Sub-optimal sample amounts and quality may require modifications to the method and elevation of the method reporting limit (RL). Non-representative samples may affect results.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"frd","text":"
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"jfmk","text":"Quality Control and Reference Material","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":38}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7miu2","text":"Internal standard (IS) is added to each reagent blank, control sample, and sample prior to extraction.  The IS used is 13C2, d2-sodium monofluoroacetate, added at a concentration of 10 ppb.   ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":119,"length":2},{"style":"sub","offset":122,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":126,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7qis5","text":"Each set of samples must include a negative, unfortified control (check) sample from an appropriate control matrix.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7e78v","text":"It is recommended, at the discretion of the analyst, to include a reagent blank with each set of samples ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a6tjs","text":"Each set of samples must include a spiked (fortified) sample from an appropriate control matrix or an over spike of the sample material.  The following spike levels are suggested:","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"attvn","text":"                  5 ppb level:  add 0.005 mL of 1 µg/mL spiking standard into 1 g of control kidney     
                  10 ppb level:  add 0.010 mL of 1 µg/mL spiking standard into 1 g of control kidney ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1gj20","text":"For quantitative results, a set of calibrations standards must be prepared and included","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fme8","text":"The group leader, chief chemist or the toxicologist may approve deviations from these guidelines to meet the diagnostic utility of the test.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dbhrl","text":"
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ani0","text":"METHOD LIMITATIONS","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"csmp6","text":"
The sample clean-up by SPE requires Compound 1080 be present as an anion.  With a pKa value of 2.66, this
requires that the extract be at a pH value of 4.66 or greater prior to loading onto the MAX SPE resin.  It is
recommended to test the pH of the extract prior to loading onto the MAX SPE resin to verify this.  During validation,
extracts from spiked kidneys and incurred kidneys were shown to be ~pH 7.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2ale2","text":"
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5cl30","text":"DOCUMENT AND RECORD REQUIREMENTS","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":32}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"77i1r","text":"
The following information, as applicable, must be recorded in the lab notebook or other sample preparation records:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2c0m","text":"Name of analyst prepping the samples; ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7j43f","text":" Date manipulations were started (extraction date);","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dcmc","text":" Method extraction description (ex SOP number)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cqahh","text":" Sample ID (full accession number)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ear1e","text":"  QC sample(s) IDs (QC ID or Lot Number)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6hhj4","text":"  Physical manipulations performed on samples and QC samples including: ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5dvto","text":"            amount measured","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9gpdv","text":"            dilutions","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"86j23","text":"            aliquot amount","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fmlbk","text":"            final volumes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7gvci","text":"            Spiking information: ID of spiking solution used, initials and date of person performing spiking.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e65si","text":"            Pipet ID #","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"sprk","text":"            Lot #s of SPEs ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2b2k3","text":"            Signature/Date of analyst upon completion","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"anvkr","text":"
This is the minimum amount of information that should be recorded.  If certain of the above data elements are not relevant then they may be excluded.





","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4o3t9","text":"5% Ammonium hydroxide in water","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ei8f7","text":"Add   of 0.50 µg/mL 13C2, d2-sodium monofluoroacetate (IS) solution","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":20,"length":2},{"style":"sub","offset":23,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":27,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"b4gij","text":"\n\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"0.020","error":false,"guid":"EE9E046027D311EE9A8BB12587BE14C4","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4jcft","text":"Add   of water and 2 ball bearings","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"19h65","text":"\n\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"4","error":false,"guid":"F17EDD3027D311EE9A8BB12587BE14C4","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cp90b","text":"Genogrind at 750 rpm for  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":25,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"o5bn","text":"\n\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"0CA9D1F027D411EE9A8BB12587BE14C4","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"52eo","text":"Remove ball bearings using a magnet","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b5a46","text":"\n\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"afiej","text":"Cartridges are first conditioned by rinsing with   of methanol, followed by rinsing with  of water, and then an additional   of water ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":49,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":88,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":123,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2pfdk","text":"\n\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"4","error":false,"guid":"3856B2A027D411EE9A8BB12587BE14C4","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"3","error":false,"guid":"3A1FD9E027D411EE9A8BB12587BE14C4","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"3","error":false,"guid":"3D1265F027D411EE9A8BB12587BE14C4","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9elbb","text":"  of the flow-through from the protein concentrator is next loaded onto the resin, taking care to load at a flow rate of no more than 1 drop per second","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3tc92","text":"\n\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"2","error":false,"guid":"3FB23E2027D411EE9A8BB12587BE14C4","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4u5o0","text":"Cartridge is washed with 3 mL of 0.5% trifluoroacetic acid in acetonitrile, and then pulled dry under vacuum for  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":113,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"efl7n","text":"\n\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":30,"guid":"5525936027D411EE9A8BB12587BE14C4","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7i4of","text":"A 15 mL centrifuge is placed under each SPE column as a collection tube, and then the cartridge is eluted with 2 mL of 0.5% trifluoroacetic acid in acetonitrile at a flow rate of no more than 1 drop per second, and then pulled dry under vacuum for  , collecting the eluent","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":248,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2p0ll","text":"\n\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":30,"guid":"65BC18C027D411EE9A8BB12587BE14C4","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"25e5k","text":"The cartridge is eluted again with  of 0.5% trifluoroacetic acid in acetonitrile at a flow rate of no more than 1 drop per second, and then pulled dry under vacuum for  , collecting the eluent in the same collection tube, for a total volume of   pooled eluent","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":34,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":168,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":244,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4k9b2","text":"\n\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"2","error":false,"guid":"68AA5F1027D411EE9A8BB12587BE14C4","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":30,"guid":"6D4284D027D411EE9A8BB12587BE14C4","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"4","error":false,"guid":"6EEE601027D411EE9A8BB12587BE14C4","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b06eb","text":"Data is acquired using SciEx OS software","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"49rr9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2v1e0","text":"   The sequence should begin and end with analysis of the calibration standards ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b0l6c","text":"\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6joc1","text":"The beginning set of standards are followed by a fortified control sample (spike) or overspiked sample","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e2f0n","text":"\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8qg4r","text":"    All sample and QC sample injections are done in duplicate","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6p4be","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9nq96","text":"Sets of sample injections should be preceded by a reagent blank or an unfortified control sample (check) to demonstrate that no carryover from standards or fortified control is present","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"o798","text":"\n\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cvepj","text":"All calculations are performed using the Analyst software within SciEx OS software","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3pqks","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9037q","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fi9v9","text":"\n\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"d8qf2","text":"Expected values- Compound 1080 in kidney may be found down to low ppb levels","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1tuim","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fvk7p","text":"The analysis is acceptable if the reagent blank and/or check sample are negative, and reporting limit (RL) spike results for the analyte meets the criteria for positive identification (sec. 2, below).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3occ6","text":"\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2m8b2","text":"An analyte is considered positively identified if it meets the following criteria:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a0jer","text":"\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bn1fm","text":"The peak height signal to noise is greater than 3:1","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3fb2f","text":"\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"auc8","text":"The retention time of the analyte in the sample does not differ from that of the midpoint standard in the calibration curve by more than 0.25 min","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"47evf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dhmpl","text":"The ratio of the peak area of the quantifier ion to that of the qualifier ion does not differ more\nthan 20% from either that of the average of the ion ratios from the calibration standards –-or- from that of the midpoint standard from the opening calibration curve.\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7u1jl","text":"The group leader, chief chemist or the toxicologist may approve deviations from these guidelines to meet the diagnostic utility of the test.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e46ne","text":"\n\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fv3vh","text":"Criteria for Data Acceptance (Quantitation)- The following conditions must be met for a concentration to be reported for the analyte:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"69qtq","text":"\n\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8fgs6","text":"The peak area ratio of the analyte to that of its internal standard in the sample must fall within\nthe range of peak area ratios determined by the calibration curve\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3rlrt","text":"The spike recovery for the analyte should be between 70% and 120%.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9ivoa","text":"\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2tf07","text":" If the sequence ends with a standard curve, then the two standardcurves are combined and the coefficient of determination (R2) for the combined curve must be \u003e0.99.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":125,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9eu67","text":"\n\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9rf65","text":"If the sequence ends with a midpoint standard from the calibration curve, then the R2 for the analyte in the calibration curve must be 0.99 and the calculated concentration of analyte in the midpoint standard must fall within +/- 20%.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":84,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9ribv","text":"\n\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9fkj3","text":"The group leader and/or chief chemist can approve any deviations from these guidelines to meet the diagnostic utility of this test.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7hc6m","text":"\n\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eco4o","text":"When working in the lab, observe all CAHFS lab safety requirements and wear appropriate personal protective equipment (PPE), including gloves, safety glasses, and lab coat.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5btc6","text":"
In addition:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"991uo","text":"All operations which may liberate an aerosol, for example (but not limited to) pipetting and filtering, must be done in a biological safety hood up until the sample extract has passed through the protein concentrator.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6eal2","text":"Sodium monofluoroacetate (Compound 1080) is highly toxic","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"10hsq","text":"Formic acid, trifluoroacetic acid, and ammonium hydroxide are all highly corrosive","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f3aod","text":"Methanol and acetonitrile are flammable","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1hmu3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7pbof","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"85tia","text":"Waste disposal:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d39rt","text":"All chemical wastes must be disposed of following the appropriate CAHFS procedures      ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2g9u9","text":"All potentially infective biological wastes must be disposed of
following the appropriate CAHFS procedures","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7aeqt","text":"
